text:
The SVG pretty printer seems to output bogus ampersand escapes.

Once before it converted a decimal escape to a hex escape,
e.g., ¬ -> ¬ but then barfed when trying to read it.

Currently it seems to be adding an extra '#' character.

Here is a diff showing before and after:
--- xx.svg.1    Mon Mar  7 21:10:08 2005
+++ xx.svg      Mon Mar  7 21:10:12 2005
@@ -2,13 +2,15 @@
 <!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.0//EN"
     "http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd" >
 
+
 <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
      xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" id="body" width="640"
      height="480" viewBox="0 0 640 480">
 
     <text x="100" y="100" font-size="12" fill="#000000">
         <tspan>
-            Time is 100µsec.
+            Time is 100&##181;
+            sec.
         </tspan>
     </text>
 

Note also that is adding a spurious blank line at the beginning each time.
I.e., pretty printing should be an idempotent operation.

Java version:

Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build
1.4.2-p5-archie_18_nov_2003_16_43)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-p5-archie_18_nov_2003_16_43, mixed mode)
creator: archie@dellroad.org
